pull.title: Introduce g_wallet_manager, prepare for better dynamic wallet loading/unloading
pull.body:
This PR moves manipulation and knowledge of `vpwallet` (the vector holding the CWallet* pointers) into `CWalletManager`. All access will go through the global g_wallet_manager (similar to g_connman).
This should it make easier to later add concurrency protection for wallet adding (loading) / unloading as well as it cleans up the code.

There is a lot of room for optimisation, but, to make faster progress, the scope of this PR should not be widened.

events.body: In #11402 I've changed to shared pointer to manage the lifecycle of wallets. Maybe that's out of scope?
Rebased. Fixed points reported by @promag and the travis issue.

events.message:
Revert CWalletRef
Prepare for a better pointer handling

events.body: I guess this makes no longer sense after #10762. Closing.

comments.body: Between the above call `HasWallets()` and `GetWalletAtPos()` the wallet can be unloaded. Not possible at the moment, but maybe we should take the opportunity to add a lock to `g_wallet_manager`?

comments.diff_hunk:
@@ -0,0 +1,84 @@
+// Copyright (c) 2018 The Bitcoin Core developers
+// Distributed under the MIT software license, see the accompanying
+// file COPYING or http://www.opensource.org/licenses/mit-license.php.
+
+#include <wallet/walletmanager.h>
+#include <wallet/wallet.h>
+
+std::unique_ptr<CWalletManager> g_wallet_manager;

@@ -0,0 +1,56 @@
+// Copyright (c) 2018 The Bitcoin Core developers
+// Distributed under the MIT software license, see the accompanying
+// file COPYING or http://www.opensource.org/licenses/mit-license.php.
+
+#ifndef BITCOIN_WALLET_WALLETMANAGER_H
+#define BITCOIN_WALLET_WALLETMANAGER_H
+
+#include <wallet/wallet.h>
+
+#include <vector>
+#include <util.h>
+
+class CWalletManager {
+private:
+    std::vector<CWallet*> m_vpwallets;
+
+public:
+    //! Load wallet databases.
+    bool OpenWallets();
+
+    //! Complete startup of wallets.
+    void StartWallets(CScheduler& scheduler);
+
+    //! Flush all wallets in preparation for shutdown.
+    void FlushWallets();
+
+    //! Stop all wallets. Wallets will be flushed first.
+    void StopWallets();
+
+    //! Close all wallets.
+    void CloseWallets();
+
+    void AddWallet(CWallet *wallet);
+    void DeallocWallet(unsigned int pos);
+
+    bool HasWallets();
+
+    unsigned int CountWallets();
+
+    template<typename Callable>
+    void ForEachWallet(Callable&& func)
comments.body: Why not just return a copy of the array?

comments.diff_hunk:
@@ -0,0 +1,56 @@
+// Copyright (c) 2018 The Bitcoin Core developers
+// Distributed under the MIT software license, see the accompanying
+// file COPYING or http://www.opensource.org/licenses/mit-license.php.
+
+#ifndef BITCOIN_WALLET_WALLETMANAGER_H
+#define BITCOIN_WALLET_WALLETMANAGER_H
+
+#include <wallet/wallet.h>
+
+#include <vector>
+#include <util.h>
+
+class CWalletManager {
+private:
+    std::vector<CWallet*> m_vpwallets;
+
+public:
+    //! Load wallet databases.
+    bool OpenWallets();
+
+    //! Complete startup of wallets.
+    void StartWallets(CScheduler& scheduler);
+
+    //! Flush all wallets in preparation for shutdown.
+    void FlushWallets();
+
+    //! Stop all wallets. Wallets will be flushed first.
+    void StopWallets();
+
+    //! Close all wallets.
+    void CloseWallets();
+
+    void AddWallet(CWallet *wallet);
+    void DeallocWallet(unsigned int pos);
+
+    bool HasWallets();
+
+    unsigned int CountWallets();
+
+    template<typename Callable>
+    void ForEachWallet(Callable&& func)
comments.body: I think a lambda is more flexible... same reason we use it in `CNode`/`g_conman`.
Indeed. The locking would be the next step (not only for this case). But its out of scope for this PR.

comments.diff_hunk:
@@ -0,0 +1,84 @@
+// Copyright (c) 2018 The Bitcoin Core developers
+// Distributed under the MIT software license, see the accompanying
+// file COPYING or http://www.opensource.org/licenses/mit-license.php.
+
+#include <wallet/walletmanager.h>
+#include <wallet/wallet.h>
+
+std::unique_ptr<CWalletManager> g_wallet_manager;

@@ -0,0 +1,56 @@
+// Copyright (c) 2018 The Bitcoin Core developers
+// Distributed under the MIT software license, see the accompanying
+// file COPYING or http://www.opensource.org/licenses/mit-license.php.
+
+#ifndef BITCOIN_WALLET_WALLETMANAGER_H
+#define BITCOIN_WALLET_WALLETMANAGER_H
+
+#include <wallet/wallet.h>
+
+#include <vector>
+#include <util.h>
+
+class CWalletManager {
+private:
+    std::vector<CWallet*> m_vpwallets;
+
+public:
+    //! Load wallet databases.
+    bool OpenWallets();
+
+    //! Complete startup of wallets.
+    void StartWallets(CScheduler& scheduler);
+
+    //! Flush all wallets in preparation for shutdown.
+    void FlushWallets();
+
+    //! Stop all wallets. Wallets will be flushed first.
+    void StopWallets();
+
+    //! Close all wallets.
+    void CloseWallets();
+
+    void AddWallet(CWallet *wallet);
+    void DeallocWallet(unsigned int pos);
+
+    bool HasWallets();
+
+    unsigned int CountWallets();
+
+    template<typename Callable>
+    void ForEachWallet(Callable&& func)
comments.body: In `g_connman` makes sense because `cs_vNodes` is held all the time. Here we don't have locks. Even when we add dynamic wallets, IMHO the same pattern doesn't apply here.

comments.diff_hunk:
@@ -0,0 +1,56 @@
+// Copyright (c) 2018 The Bitcoin Core developers
+// Distributed under the MIT software license, see the accompanying
+// file COPYING or http://www.opensource.org/licenses/mit-license.php.
+

+
+#include <vector>
+#include <util.h>
+
+class CWalletManager {

+
+public:
+    //! Load wallet databases.
+    bool OpenWallets();
+
+    //! Complete startup of wallets.
+    void StartWallets(CScheduler& scheduler);
+
+    //! Flush all wallets in preparation for shutdown.

+

+
+    template<typename Callable>
+    void ForEachWallet(Callable&& func)
comments.body: IMO, once we add the locking (not the scope of this PR), then it makes more sense to keep the locking inside of the manager instead of returning a copy.
